item.title: Calling a spade a spade
item.description: Calling a spade a spade James C. Wang Referring to Taiwan as “The Republic of Taiwan,” President George W. Bush of the United States caused an uproar in China and a ripple in Taiwan. As can be expected, Beijing asked for clarification and government-controlled media expressed their dismay and indignation. That is routine business. No matter whether the remark is intentional or a slip of tongue, Beijing has no choice but to protest and put their position on the record.
